name: Cannibis indica
Relationship: Bellad.; Hyoscy.; Stram.; Laches.; Agaric.; Anhalonium (time sense disordered; time periods enormously overestimated; thus, minutes seem hours, etc.).
Modalities: Worse: liquor and tobacco; lying on right side

Respiratory: Chest oppressed with deep, labored breathing
Stomach: Sensation of extreme tension in abdominal vessels - feel distended to bursting
Pain at cardiac orifice; better, pressure
Rectum: Sensation in anus as if sitting on a ball
Urine: Dull pain in region of right kidney
Must strain; dribbling; has to wait some time before the urine flows
Mind: Cannot realize her identity, chronic vertigo as of floating off
Anxious depression; constant fear of becoming insane
Time seems too long; seconds seem ages; a few rods an immense distance
Emotional excitement; rapid change of mood
Head: Shocks through brain
Headache with flatulence
Throbbing and weight at occiput
Feels as if top of head were opening and shutting and as if calvarium were being lifted
Uraemic headache
Involuntary shaking of head
Migraine attack preceded by unusual excitement with loquacity
Sleep: Obstinate and intractable forms of insomnia
Very sleepy, but unable to do so
Female: Menses profuse, dark, painful, without clots
Uterine colic, with great nervous agitation and sleeplessness
Extremities: Pain in soles and calves; sharp pains in knees and ankles; very exhausted after a short walk
Entire paralysis of the lower extremities
Thrilling through arms and hands, and from knees down
Pain across shoulders and spine; must stoop; cannot walk erect
Male: Sensation of swelling in perineum or near anus, as if sitting on a ball
Oozing of white, glairy mucus from glans

details: Inhibits the higher faculties and stimulates the imagination to a remarkable degree without any marked stimulation of the lower or animal instinct. A condition of INTENSE EXALTATION, in which all perceptions and conceptions, all sensations and emotions are exaggerated to the utmost degree. Subconscious or DUAL NATURE STATE. Apparently under the control of the second self, but, the original self, prevents the performance of acts which are under the domination of the second self. Apparently the two natures cannot act independently, one acting as a check, upon the other. (Effects of one Dram doses by Dr. Albert Schneider.) The experimenter feels ever and anon that he is distinct from the subject of the hashish dream and can think rationally. Produces the most remarkable hallucinations and imaginations, EXAGGERATION OF THE DURATION OF TIME AND EXTENT OF SPACE, BEING MOST CHARACTERISTIC. Conception of time, space and place is gone. Extremely happy and contented, nothing troubles. Ideas crowd upon each other. Has great soothing influence in many nervous disorders, like epilepsy, mania, dementia, delirium tremens, and irritable reflexes. Exophthalmic goitre. Catalepsy.
